title: How to Make Healing Garlic Soup

steps.headline: Slice the tops off of each garlic head and drizzle with olive oil.
steps.description:
Wrap in aluminum foil and bake at 200 degrees for 90 minutes. Cooking and oven temperatures may vary so check garlic during cooking process. You want cloves to soften and almost caramelize. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Remove from oven and allow garlic to cool. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Heat 2 tbsp.
steps.description: of butter and 2 tbsp. of olive oil in a large stock pan. Allow to heat up without smoking.

steps.headline: Add onions to hot butter and oil and allow to cook for approximately 10 minutes on medium heat.
Add cooked garlic to pan.
steps.description:
Simply squeeze the cloves from the garlic shell into the pan or into a plate to ensure you avoid adding any of the peeling. Mash garlic as it cooks and combine with onions. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Pour in chicken broth and add herbs and thyme.
steps.description:
Stir well. Lower temperature to medium low. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Add diced bread to broth mixture.
steps.description: Allow bread to cook and integrate into soup until cubes completely soften.

steps.headline: Remove herbs from pan and allow broth to cool.
steps.description: You don't want the broth to become completely cold, but cool enough to be transferred to a blender.

steps.headline: Blend soup on high until all ingredients are well combined.
steps.description: You want to achieve a creamy, smooth texture.

steps.headline: Return soup to saucepan and cook on medium heat.
Add sour cream and salt and pepper to taste as soup warms.

text:
Slice the tops off of each garlic head and drizzle with olive oil. Wrap in aluminum foil and bake at 200 degrees for 90 minutes. Cooking and oven temperatures may vary so check garlic during cooking process. You want cloves to soften and almost caramelize. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Remove from oven and allow garlic to cool. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Heat 2 tbsp. of butter and 2 tbsp. of olive oil in a large stock pan. Allow to heat up without smoking. Add onions to hot butter and oil and allow to cook for approximately 10 minutes on medium heat. Stir and toss often. Add cooked garlic to pan. Simply squeeze the cloves from the garlic shell into the pan or into a plate to ensure you avoid adding any of the peeling. Mash garlic as it cooks and combine with onions. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Pour in chicken broth and add herbs and thyme. Stir well. Lower temperature to medium low. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Healing-Garlic-Soup-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Add diced bread to broth mixture. Allow bread to cook and integrate into soup until cubes completely soften. Remove herbs from pan and allow broth to cool. You don't want the broth to become completely cold, but cool enough to be transferred to a blender. Blend soup on high until all ingredients are well combined. You want to achieve a creamy, smooth texture. Return soup to saucepan and cook on medium heat. Add sour cream and salt and pepper to taste as soup warms. Finished.
